BinaryAttachment.name: BinaryAttachment

fields.name: body
fields.description: The body of the attachment.

fields.name: fileName
fields.description: The name of the attached file.

fields.name: headers
fields.description: Any header values associated with the attachment. Examples of header names include Content-Type, Content-Transfer-Encoding, and Content-ID.

constructors.name: InboundEmail.BinaryAttachment
constructors.description: Creates a new instance of the Messaging.InboundEmail.BinaryAttachment class.

BinaryAttachment.description: An InboundEmail object stores binary attachments in an InboundEmail.BinaryAttachment object.

Header.name: Header

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the header parameter, such as Date or Message-ID.

Header.description: An InboundEmail object stores RFC 2822 email header information in an InboundEmail.Header object with the following properties.

TextAttachment.name: TextAttachment

fields.name: body
fields.description: The body of the attachment.

fields.name: bodyIsTruncated
fields.description: Indicates whether the attachment body text is truncated (true) or not (false.)

fields.name: charset
fields.description: The original character set of the body field. The body is re-encoded as UTF-8 as input to the Apex method.

fields.name: fileName
fields.description: The name of the attached file.

fields.name: headers
fields.description: Any header values associated with the attachment. Examples of header names include Content-Type, Content-Transfer-Encoding, and Content-ID.

constructors.name: InboundEmail.TextAttachment
constructors.description: Creates a new instance of the Messaging.InboundEmail.TextAttachment class.

TextAttachment.description: An InboundEmail object stores text attachments in an InboundEmail.TextAttachment object.

fields.name: binaryAttachments
fields.description: A list of binary attachments received with the email, if any.

fields.name: ccAddresses
fields.description: A list of carbon copy (CC) addresses, if any.

fields.name: fromAddress
fields.description: The email address that appears in the From field.

fields.name: fromName
fields.description: The name that appears in the From field, if any.

fields.name: headers
fields.description: A list of the RFC 2822 headers in the email.

fields.name: htmlBody
fields.description: The HTML version of the email, if specified by the sender.

fields.name: htmlBodyIsTruncated
fields.description: Indicates whether the HTML body text is truncated (true) or not (false.)

fields.name: inReplyTo
fields.description: The In-Reply-To field of the incoming email. Identifies the email or emails to which this one is a reply (parent emails). Contains the parent email or emails' message-IDs.

fields.name: messageId
fields.description: The Message-IDâ€”the incoming email's unique identifier.

fields.name: plainTextBody
fields.description: The plain text version of the email, if specified by the sender.

fields.name: plainTextBodyIsTruncated
fields.description: Indicates whether the plain body text is truncated (true) or not (false.)

fields.name: references
fields.description: The References field of the incoming email. Identifies an email thread. Contains a list of the parent emails' References and message IDs, and possibly the In-Reply-To fields.

fields.name: replyTo
fields.description: The email address that appears in the reply-to header.

fields.name: subject
fields.description: The subject line of the email, if any.

fields.name: textAttachments
fields.description: A list of text attachments received with the email, if any.

constructors.name: InboundEmail
constructors.description: Creates a new instance of the Messaging.InboundEmail class.
